nodes.bodyText: Did we figure out a way to share test classes from Azure Core?

Yep. I copied them over. This works, but if you re-import the project into Android Studio it no longer understands the project structure of Core because it mistakenly thinks that the src directory belongs to azure-storage-blob. Building from the commandline still works fine obviously, it's just a mistake in how Studio infers the project structure from the gradle files. I wasn't able to correct it either, "modules" section of the project structure dialog didn't show any of the libraries any more. After a couple hours knocking my head against the desk I figured out this line was causing the issue.

Should this be capitalized like what we do with Azure Communication Services?

nodes.bodyText:
Maybe? Even the official docs page mixes the casing: https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/services/storage/blobs/
But I think it makes sense for consistency. I will correct.

nodes.bodyText: Are we planning on using single quotes across our Gradle files?

Generally I follow the advice of Ruby which also has this distinction (single quotes are literals, double quotes allow interpolation) and use single quotes everywhere I don't intend for interpolation to occur. That said, I only changed them here because I was already re-ordering them. I considered changing them everywhere but felt that was too disruptive for this PR.
